001package io.cyborgcode.roa.api.core;
002
003import io.restassured.RestAssured;
004import io.restassured.http.ContentType;
005import io.restassured.http.Method;
006import io.restassured.specification.RequestSpecification;
007import java.util.Collections;
008import java.util.List;
009import java.util.Map;
010
011import static io.cyborgcode.roa.api.config.ApiConfigHolder.getApiConfig;
012
013/**
014 * Represents an API endpoint definition.
015 *
016 * <p>This interface defines the essential properties and methods for interacting with an API endpoint.
017 * It supports request configuration, query and path parameter management, and automatic request logging.
018 *
019 * @author Cyborg Code Syndicate üíçüë®üíª
020 */
021public interface Endpoint<T extends Enum<T>> {
022
023   /**
024    * Retrieves the HTTP method associated with this endpoint.
025    *
026    * @return The HTTP method of the endpoint.
027    */
028   Method method();
029
030   /**
031    * Retrieves the relative URL path of this endpoint.
032    *
033    * @return The endpoint URL.
034    */
035   String url();
036
037   /**
038    * Retrieves the enum implementation of this endpoint.
039    *
040    * @return The enum representing this endpoint.
041    */
042   T enumImpl();
043
044   /**
045    * Retrieves the base URL for this endpoint.
046    *
047    * @return The base URL from the API configuration.
048    */
049   default String baseUrl() {
050      return getApiConfig().baseUrl();
051   }
052
053   /**
054    * Retrieves the headers associated with this endpoint.
055    *
056    * <p>By default, this returns an empty map unless overridden.
057    *
058    * @return A map containing header key-value pairs.
059    */
060   default Map<String, List<String>> headers() {
061      return Collections.emptyMap();
062   }
063
064   /**
065    * Prepares a default {@link RequestSpecification} with base configuration.
066    *
067    * <p>Configures base URI, headers, and logging based on API configuration.
068    *
069    * @return The configured request specification.
070    */
071   default RequestSpecification defaultConfiguration() {
072      RequestSpecification spec = RestAssured.given()
073         .baseUri(baseUrl())
074         .contentType(ContentType.JSON)
075         .accept(ContentType.JSON)
076         .headers(headers());
077
078      if (getApiConfig().restAssuredLoggingEnabled()) {
079         switch (getApiConfig().restAssuredLoggingLevel()) {
080            case "BASIC" -> spec.log().ifValidationFails();
081            case "ALL" -> spec.log().all();
082            case "NONE" -> { /* No logging */ }
083            default -> throw new IllegalArgumentException("Unsupported logging level");
084         }
085      }
086
087      return spec;
088   }
089
090   /**
091    * Prepares a request specification for the endpoint, optionally including a request body.
092    *
093    * @param body The request body to be sent with the request.
094    * @return A configured {@link RequestSpecification} instance.
095    */
096   default RequestSpecification prepareRequestSpec(Object body) {
097      validateEndpoint();
098      RequestSpecification spec = defaultConfiguration().basePath(url());
099      if (body != null) {
100         spec.body(body);
101      }
102      return spec;
103   }
104
105   /**
106    * Creates a new instance of this endpoint with an added query parameter.
107    *
108    * @param key   The query parameter name.
109    * @param value The query parameter value.
110    * @return A new instance of the endpoint with the query parameter added.
111    */
112   default Endpoint<T> withQueryParam(String key, Object value) {
113      return new ParametrizedEndpoint<T>(this).withQueryParam(key, value);
114   }
115
116   /**
117    * Creates a new instance of this endpoint with an added path parameter.
118    *
119    * @param key   The path parameter name.
120    * @param value The path parameter value.
121    * @return A new instance of the endpoint with the path parameter added.
122    */
123   default Endpoint<T> withPathParam(String key, Object value) {
124      return new ParametrizedEndpoint<T>(this).withPathParam(key, value);
125   }
126
127   /**
128    * Creates a new instance of this endpoint with an added request header.
129    *
130    * @param key   The header name.
131    * @param value The header value.
132    * @return A new instance of the endpoint with the header added.
133    */
134   default Endpoint<T> withHeader(String key, String value) {
135      return new ParametrizedEndpoint<T>(this).withHeader(key, value);
136   }
137
138   /**
139    * Creates a new instance of this endpoint with an added request header supporting multiple values.
140    *
141    * @param key    The header name.
142    * @param values A list of values for the header.
143    * @return A new instance of the endpoint with the multi-value header added.
144    */
145   default Endpoint<T> withHeader(String key, List<String> values) {
146      return new ParametrizedEndpoint<T>(this).withHeader(key, values);
147   }
148
149   /**
150    * Validates that the endpoint has the necessary configurations set.
151    *
152    * <p>Ensures that the URL and HTTP method are not null or empty before making a request.
153    *
154    * @throws IllegalStateException if the URL or method is missing.
155    */
156   private void validateEndpoint() {
157      if (url() == null || url().isEmpty()) {
158         throw new IllegalStateException("URL must not be null or empty for endpoint: " + enumImpl().name());
159      }
160      if (method() == null) {
161         throw new IllegalStateException("HTTP method must not be null for endpoint: " + enumImpl().name());
162      }
163   }
164}
